tp:docstring.p: The Media Player Remote Interfacing specification is a standard D-Bus interface which aims to provide a common programmatic API for controlling media players.
Each media player must request an unique bus name which begins with org.mpris. For example:

media players must expose at least the three following object paths whenever they are running:
/org/mpris/MediaPlayer which implements the org.mpris.MediaPlayer interface
/org/mpris/MediaPlayer/Player which implements the org.mpris.MediaPlayer.Player interface
/org/mpris/MediaPlayer/TrackList which implements the org.mpris.MediaPlayer.TrackList interface
A free form string representing media player identity, such as Totem 2.22.2.

arg.name: Identity
arg.tp:docstring: A string containing the media player identification.

tp:struct.name: Version_Struct
tp:struct.tp:docstring: A struct representing the MPRIS spec version.

method.name: MprisVersion
method.tp:docstring: Returns a struct that represents the version of the MPRIS spec being implemented.

tp:docstring.p: The Identity, Quit, and MprisVersion methods must be accessed through the "/org/mpris/MediaPlayer" object path.

arg.name: Position
arg.tp:docstring: Position in the TrackList of the item of which the metadata is requested.

tp:docstring.p: Gives all meta data available for element at given position in the TrackList, counting from 0.

Guidelines for field names are at
http://wiki.xmms2.xmms.se/wiki/MPRIS_Metadata .

arg.name: Position
arg.tp:docstring: Position in the TrackList of the active element.

tp:docstring.p: Return the position of current URI in the TrackList The return value is zero-based, so the position of the first URI in the TrackList is 0. The behavior of this method is unspecified if there are zero elements in the TrackList.

arg.name: Length
arg.tp:docstring: Number of elements in the TrackList.

method.name: AddTrack

arg.name: Uri
arg.tp:docstring: The uri of the item to append.

arg.name: PlayImmediately
arg.tp:docstring: TRUE if the item should be played immediately, FALSE otherwise.

method.tp:docstring: Appends an URI in the TrackList.

method.name: DelTrack

arg.name: Position
arg.tp:docstring: Position in the tracklist of the item to remove.

method.tp:docstring: Removes an URI from the TrackList.

arg.name: State
arg.tp:docstring: TRUE to loop, FALSE to stop looping.

method.name: SetRandom

arg.name: State
arg.tp:docstring: TRUE to play randomly / shuffle playlist, FALSE to play normally / reorder playlist.

method.tp:docstring: Toggle playlist shuffle / random. It may or may not play tracks only once.

arg.name: Nb_Tracks
arg.tp:docstring: The number of elements in the TrackList after the change happened.

tp:docstring.p:
Signal is emitted when the "TrackList" content has changed:
When one or more elements have been added
When one or more elements have been removed
When the ordering of elements has changed
Those methods must be access though the "/org/mpris/MediaPlayer/TrackList" object path.

Note that if CAN_HAS_TRACKLIST is false, the methods described here must be implemented as no-ops, except GetMetadata (which is valid only if given argument is 0), GetCurrentTrack (which always returns 0), GetLength (which will return 0 or 1), and AddTrack.

Goes to the next element. (What if we're at the end? NOTE Nothing terrible needs to happen, the player should just ignore it. However UIs, and maybe not only UIs, can receive a hint as to whether there is a next track using the Caps API)
Goes to the previous element. (what if we're at the beginning? See note for Next)

method.name: Pause
method.tp:docstring: If playing : pause. If paused : unpause.

method.name: Play
method.tp:docstring: If playing : rewind to the beginning of current track, else: start playing.

arg.name: State
arg.tp:docstring: TRUE to repeat the current track, FALSE to stop repeating.

tp:struct.name: Status_Struct
tp:struct.tp:docstring: The status of the media player.

tp:member.name: Repeat_Current_State
tp:member.tp:docstring: 0 = Go to the next element once the current has finished playing, 1 = Repeat the current element.

tp:member.name: Endless_State
tp:member.tp:docstring: 0 = Stop playing once the last element has been played, 1 = Never give up playing

method.name: GetStatus
method.tp:docstring: Return the status of media player as a struct of 4 ints.

tp:docstring.p: Gives all meta data available for the currently played element.

Guidelines for field names are at
http://wiki.xmms2.xmms.se/wiki/MPRIS_Metadata .

tp:flag.tp:docstring: There is a current next track, or at least something that equals to it (that is, the remote can call the 'Next' method on the interface, and expect something to happen, heh).
Same as for NEXT, just previous track/something.
Can currently pause. This might not always be possible, and is yet another hint for frontends as to what to indicate.

Whether playback can currently be started. This might not be the case if e.g. the playlist is empty in a player, or similar conditions. Here, again, it is entirely up to the player to decide when it can play or not, and it should signalize this using the caps API.
Whether seeking is possible with the currently played stream (UIs/frontends can then enable/disable seeking controls).
Whether metadata can be acquired for the currently played stream/source using GetMetadata at all.
Whether the media player can hold a list of several items.

tp:docstring.p: Return the "media player"'s current capabilities.
Volume type: integer between [0;100].
Time in milliseconds.
Signal is emitted when the "Media Player" plays another "Track". Argument of the signal is the metadata attached to the new "Track".
Signal is emitted when the status of the "Media Player" change. The argument has the same meaning as the value returned by GetStatus.
Signal is emitted when the "Media Player" changes capabilities, see GetCaps method.
Those methods must be access though the "/org/mpris/MediaPlayer/Player" object path.
